Literature Review: Disparities in eye care access and utilization have been a persistent issue in the United States, affecting various populations disproportionately. This narrative review synthesizes the existing literature to explore the multifaceted factors contributing to these disparities, guided by the Healthy People 2030 framework. The review focuses on social determinants of health (SDOH) and their impact on general and follow-up engagement, screenings, diagnostic visits, treatment, technology, and teleophthalmology.
